results.title: Antoine et Colette
results.brief_description:
Antoine Doinel falls for a music student, but spends an evening with her parents while she’s out on a date. This film is one of five internationally produced tales exploring love and young people and titled ‘L’amour a vingt ans’ (Love at twenty). Other participating filmmakers were Rossellini (Italy), Shitaro Ishiara (Japan), Marcel Ophuls (West Germany) and Andrzej Wajda (Poland). As a part of the Antoine Doinel series, this intermediary piece takes place immediately after ‘Les 400 coups’(The 400 blows) and before ‘Baisers voles’ (Stolen kisses). Further viewing: ‘Francois Truffaut: The Antoine Cycle’ (VHS) [2081667].

Credits: Producer, Pierre Roustang ; director, Francois Truffaut ; writer, Francois Truffaut ; photography, Raoul Coutard ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Leaud, Marie-France Pisier, Rosy Varte, Francois Darbon, Patrick Auffray.

results.title: Antiques of advertising
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: Ads for defunct and foreign products are interspersed with newsreel and documentary footage. The result is a distanced view of the link between desire and commodities. For instance, footage of the Hitler youth with ‘S’ shirts performing a swastika is overlaid with an ad for “Stabil”. Products become strange interlopers when they pop up in romantic movies of the Nazi period. Ads in other languages also strip products of desire: Soviet fashion is demonstrated in Cyrillic, phallic chocolates unwrap magically, and a product named ‘Time’ is sucked dry to a Japanese voiceover. A hollow product of unknown use floats in space like the monolith of 2001.

results.title: Antiques for Everyone
results.brief_description: Antiques for Everyone dispels the myth that antiques are only for the rich, the collector or the expert. Renowned collector and antique dealer Kerry Trollope, takes you on an informative journey through the fascinating world of antiques of the 18th and 19th century. Covering four areas - glass, furniture, porcelain and silver - he explains dating techniques, restoration, various technical terms, investment aspects and the interesting combination of using antiques in a contemporary atmosphere. Rated: G

results.title: Antiques at auction
results.creator_credit: Ronald Spencer and Lion Pacesetter Films
results.brief_description: Explains the workings of a modern antique sale-room, department by department. The task of selling the contents of a house is taken over by Phillips Son and Neale, who classify and catalogue the effects. The climax is the auction itself, with its central focus of the rostrum and the interplay of bidders

results.title: Antigonish
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: From places far distant, students come to this quiet Nova Scotia town to study the cooperative movement and to learn skills they can take back to their own countries. At St. Francis Xavier University, Antigonish, this film shows the work of the Coady International Institute.

results.title: Antigone by Sophocles: a discussion
results.creator_credit: Country Education Project and David Zweck
results.brief_description: Dennis Pryor of Melbourne Univeristy and Jenny Webb discuss Sophocles’ play in detail. Characters, themes and backgrounds are explored and illustrated with readings from the play.

results.title: Anti-matter
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Physics, Lewis C. Hall and Carlos Gutierrez-Mena
results.brief_description: This program explores the subject of anti-matter; its significance as a destructive process and the possibility of its constructive use. It explains matter, anti-matter and explores the possibility that large quantities of anti-matter exist in space.

results.title: Anthrax
results.brief_description: Traces the early investigation into the control of Anthrax disease in sheep and cattle. The film recalls the losses, in early days, amounting to hundreds of thousands of sheep and cattle, and then proceeds to show how the problem of this disease has been largely overcome to-day. The danger of Anthrax to humans is also stressed. No other credits available.

results.title: Anthony Lucas talks about 'The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle'
results.brief_description: Oscar nominated animator Anthony Lucas (‘The Mysterious Geographic Explorations of Jasper Morello’) speaks candidly about his creative processes and inspirations. He introduces his latest work, ‘The Cabinet of Anthony Lucas: The Faulty Fandangle’, commissioned for ACMI’s ‘Screen Worlds’ exhibition. He takes us on a creative adventure from beginning to end, starting with initial ideas and inspiration, right through to the creation of the on-screen animation and mechanised components.

results.title: Antarctica: the unowned land
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction to Antarctica showing landforms, ice and animal life such as penguins and whales. Briefly touches on the impact of humans in the area. The program also spends some time studying the animal life in the Falkland Islands. No other credits available.
